DOC.brief_summary: Patients with previous malignancies have increasingly been accepted for renal transplantation. However, post-transplant malignancy risk and survival rates of these patients are unknown. Our aim was to assess if previous malignancies pose an unnecessarily high risk of post-transplant malignant tumours and if the organs as a resource are too limited for investment in this patient group.
DOC.brief_title: Post-transplant Cancer Incidence and Survival in Patients With or Without Pre-transplant Cancer
DOC.criteria: Kidney transplanted patients from January 1982 through December 2013 with or without a pre transplant cancer. Simultaneous kidney+pancreas transplantation. Islet cell transplanted patients Undiagnosed malignancies at the time of transplantation Death within a week after transplantation First transplantation at another hospital
